title: Mozilla Firefox crashes every time I close the browser.
content:
I use Mozilla Firefox as my browser. Every time I do an internet search, I get an error message:

We're Sorry

Firefox had a problem and crashed. We'll try to restore your tabs and windows when it restarts.

To help us diagnose and fix the problem, you can send us a crash report.

(checked) Tell Mozilla about the crash so they can fix it

Details (button)

(I used to write a note, even giving my phone number asking for help, but after getting no help, I stopped writing details.)

(checked) Include the address of the page I was on

Your crash report will be submitted before you quit or restart.

Restart Firefox (button) Quit Firefox (button)--this is my typical response.

Any help would be appreciated. I am a dinosaur. I can use my PC, but am not very computer savvy.

My computer details: Dell PC Windows 10, version 21H1 LAN with 14.28 GB IP assignment Automatic (DHCP) Link speed (Receive/Transmit) 100/100 Mbps Manufacturer: Intel Description: Intel (R) Ethernet Connection (2) 1219-V Driver version: 12.18.9.10

If you need to know any additional info, please tell me where to find it on the PC. Please be as detailed as possible. I am a rank amateur.
creator: bobkatin

title: Auto Dark Mode feature on websites does not work
content:
Somehow, the prefers-color-scheme: dark media query does not seem to behave correctly in my browser. I am using Firefox 89.0.2 on Windows 10 21H1 and even though I have set the system theme to dark (which Firefox's System Theme adapts to, the browser UI is dark), websites which usually adapt to it (like YouTube when set to follow the device theme) do not do so and are using the light theme regardless. This issue persists even in troubleshooting mode, so it does not seem to be related to any add-on I have installed.

Testing the same websites on Firefox Nightly (91.0a1) and Developer Edition (90.0b12), they behave as expected, adapting to my system's dark theme. The same had been the case when I had been using Firefox 88 (where it did not work as expected), while websites on Nightly and Developer Edition (versions 90 and 89, respectively) did behave as expected.

Is there some fix for this issue, some setting that is supposed to be tweaked, or can a fix be expected in an upcoming release?

title: Request for a CSS file takes 40 seconds, only for some users: 20 secs "Blocked"; 20 secs "Connecting"
content:
At first, I was debugging an EMPTY_RESPONSE issue in Chrome, but, then, I tested access to the same file in FireFox, and I saw the issue at hand: that is, instead of EMPTY_RESPONSE in Chrome (which, I figure, might involve a timeout that Chrome does but which FireFox doesn't do), I see what's shown in the attached screenshot: namely, that the request blocks for 20 seconds (trying to access an available socket, as I understand it), then takes 20 seconds "Connecting".

This seems to be something specific to the given user's machine -- maybe malware. However, I want to know more specifically what's happening. The idea is that maybe this 40 second delay in FireFox might help explain the EMPTY_RESPONSE in Chrome.

I found the following StackOverflow post: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/27740692/request-stalled-for-a-long-time-occasionally-in-chrome

From that, in particular: "If the problem occurs only when accessing a particular server, the reason might be that chrome is fetching multiple resources (like images, CSS files, etc) on parallel connections. Since, in your case, the server is on your local network, you might want to ask the server's administrator to add support for persistent TCP connections."

I've checked to be sure the app-server (WebSphere in iSeries) is configured to allow persistent connections, and that is the case (per its admin-console). The issue does occur (for those for whom it occurs) only against our iSeries WebSphere instances, not against our Windows one. So, I've suspected something in the TCP or HTTP config on our iSeries app-servers. However, only certain users have that problem. My workstation, for instance, doesn't have that problem. So, it's not clear how it could be a server-side problem.

Meanwhile, the problem does exist for at least two users outside our network. So, if it's malware, it would seem that, somehow, those two external users happen to have the same malware as certain of our internal users. However, we haven't found any malware on our internal users' machines (using Malwarebytes, etc.) -- which, though, of course, doesn't mean there isn't any there.

Also, in the attached screenshot, the file in question is from the Bootstrap third-party JavaScript library, but we're hosting the copy of it that we're using; so, it's not a matter of needing to be able to access it from a third-party server.

Any ideas about this would be much appreciated.
creator: llefever

content:
firefex 89.0.2 win 10: ff does not display all dropdown list boxes with 100% zoom factor on website ebay.de

on ebay.de, firefox does not display all drowdown-boxes wenn the zoom factor is 100% (but it does on some other values).

ebay.de displays some dropdown list boxes, after an article search has been performed, to filter search results, eg. "artikelstandort" = item location.

it depends on firefox' zoom factor if all of them a displayed or displayed correctly (on one line).

this seems to interfere with the column on the right, where ads are displayed.

title: Uploading a .app file to an <input type="file" /> is broken on Firefox
content:
My file input looks like this: ``` 

       <label role="presentation">          <input            onChange={handleInput}            type="file"            accept=".app"            style={{ display: 'none' }}          />        </label>

```

And here is my handler: ``` 

 handleInput = (evt) => {    const file = evt.target.files[0];    console.log(`File size: ${file.size}`);    uploadToServer(file);  };

```

For every extension different than ".app", this will print the size and upload the file to the server. For ".app" files, the printed file size is 0, and the server upload simply hangs. This issue is not reproducible on Chrome and Safari. I only encountered this issue for ".app" files.

title: Need to cycle querying OCSP servers to access Google services
content:
I've just set up a new Win 10 PC and I'm having trouble accessing google services from firefox. My gmail, calender and other sites keep losing connection, and if I try to navigate to google.com it simply doesn't go: no error message, no loading timeout, the tab just behaves as if I didn't ask it to go at all. All these problems are intermittent, but I'd guess I'm getting about 90% downtime.

I've found that I can solve this problem by cycling "Query OCSP responder servers to confirm the current validity of certificates" under the security settings. When I disable this all the google services promptly work again for a little while, before failing. Then I reactive it, they come back online for a few minutes, then I need to disable it again to get another period of functionality.

I've already tried running in safe mode, disabling all my addons, reinstalling firefox, making sure it has an exception on my firewall, and enabling trackers on google. None of these have helped though. Any advice would be greatly appreciated, I can't find any question on forums where cycling the OCSP servers has been necessary!

title: FireFox Version 89 Refuses to do anything
content: Firefox used to be such a great browser. It worked perfectly yesterday. Now it won't load a single page. My question is: Why does the Firefox browser refuse to work now? I type in a URL and it wont even show a loading bar, it just sits there, I can't even access the settings page, nothing is working at all with this browser. title: Roblox 'An error occurred trying to launch the experience. Please try again later.' Error Message (only FireFox)
content:
Hi

I'm trying to play Roblox on my laptop through Firefox. None of the games I click play on even try to load, they just say the message 'An error occurred trying to launch the experience. Please try again later.'

When I tried in Microsoft Edge (which I never use) the games launched fine.

I tried clearing cookies but that did not fix the issue.

Any ideas?

title: google captca blocking Fire fox from opening web sites Hulu now others earlier
content:
I have a screen print but can't seem to load The message below the "I'm not a robot" is that google is blocking firefox from opening this website. Log in with your Hulu credentials EMAIL PASSWORD Error: Please complete the reCAPTCHA above. Firefox Can’t Open This Page

To protect your security, www.google.com will not allow Firefox to display the page if another site has embedded it. To see this page, you need to open it in a new window.

Learn more… I hope this helps. Note I get the same message with or without the VPN.
